uk.ac.ucl.nterreri.patient

Class Patient

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ucl.nterreri.patient.Patient

  • public class Patient
extends java.lang.Object
    Class describing patient records. Instances of this class represent individual patient entries. Features static fields and methods to also hold an instance-invariant log of all patients records.

    Should always be used by calling its initialize() method to read existing patient records from file before any Patient instance is created: the Patient instance constructor relies on the instance-invariant log to decide the next patient id to assign to the new patient. Unique patient ids are assigned to each new patient, id numbers range from 1000 to 9999 (4 digits integers).

    Includes setters that check for format correctness where relevant (e.g. URLs must be well-formed, dates should be in "dd/mm/yyyy" format).

    Includes static methods to manage on disk records: writing to file, updating file, exporting, backup and backup restore. These features make heavy use of opencsv.

    Includes a static method to delete an entry in the records, and an instance method to add the calling instance to the top of the patient records stack. If a conflict is detected between the instance patient id number and the next expected patient id, the value of the latter is assigned to the first. This should happen where multiple patient instances are present, but they are not being added to the stack in the order they were initialized.

    Finally, includes methods to search patient records and retrieve an ArrayList of string arrays corresponding to the records matched with the query value.

    References:
    Glen Smith, Kyle Miller, Sean Sullivan, Scott Conway, Maciek Opala, J.C. Romanda, opencsv (3.6). 2015. http://opencsv.sourceforge.net/

    Jonathan Hedley. jsoup (1.8.3). 2015. http://jsoup.org/

    Many online articles, mostly posts from http://stackoverflow.com/, distributed throughout the project.

    Author:
    nterreri

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Patient()
      Default constructor adds new patient instance by calling getNextId() to figure out the appropriate patientId for the current element.
      Patient(int indexInArrayList)
      Instance re-constructor: takes data from the static patientRecords to construct a patient instance.

      • setCondition

        public void setCondition(java.lang.String condition)
                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Sets patient condition.

        Will parse the html document which is the text displayed in a PatientEditorFrame's "Condition" editor pane, and extract text from the body of the html.

        When typing into a JEditorPane which has been set to "text/html", the text typed will automatically between the "body" tags of the html document. Therefore, the text conted typed by the user must be retrieved by extracting it.

        The text extracted is appeneded to the string "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/" to automatically provide a default hyperreference for the patient's condition.

        Uses Jsoup: http://jsoup.org/

        Parameters:
        condition -
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        See Also:
        JEditorPane, http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3507353/how-to-parse-only-text-from-html, http://jsoup.org/

      • removeConditionPicture

        public void removeConditionPicture(int conditionPicIndex)
                            throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Constructs an array from the return value of getConditionPictures (conditionPictures split at whitespaces). Assigns "" to the element indexed by the parameter in this array.

        Then, resets conditionPictures to "" and adds the content of the constructed array to conditionPictures, one by one.

        Parameters:
        conditionPicIndex -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        See Also:
        #getConditionPictures()}

      • checkIDConsistency

        private boolean checkIDConsistency()
        Called by addRecord() to check for patient id consistency.
        Returns:
        false if the patient id of the calling object is not the next expected patient id, true otherwise.

      • addRecord

        public void addRecord()
               throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Adds the current patient instance to the array list patientRecords. Should only be used after these have been loaded into memory through initialize() or reloadRecordsFromFile(). Where a conflict between the patientId field of the patient instance and the mathematical successor to the last patient id number at the bottom of the patientRecords stack is detected, then the value of the latter wins.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        See Also:
        initialize(), reloadRecordsFromFile(), checkIDConsistency()

      • getNextId

        public static int getNextId()
                     throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Has to be static to be used in importCSV()
        Returns:
        the next integer after the patient id number of the last registered patient, assumes the patientRecords field is not empty. Throws number format exception if this occurs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException
        See Also:
        #Patient()}, importCSV(File)

                                                              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                                     java.io.IOException
        Reads patient data from parameter file into the patientRecords field.

        Uses opencsv.

        Returns:

      • generateEmptyRecords

        public static void generateEmptyRecords()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Creates empty file at position specified by recordsFile field.

        Intended for use when creating a new empty patient database, or to recover when no patient records can be found and no backup can be restored.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • search

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> search(int field,
                                                             java.lang.String value)
        Queries array list patientRecords for the specified string value within the specified field. Returns an empty array list where no match was found.
        Parameters:
        field -
        value -
        Returns:
        an array list of string arrays corresponding to the patient records that match the query.
